items.title: Don't always call self.close() in __exit__()
items.body:
`self.close()` should not be called when exiting with an exception.

Here's a specific real-world example using [Spotify's luigi framework](https://github.com/spotify/luigi).  Basically if an exception is raised then the output file is still partially written.

``` python
import luigi.format
import newlinejson as nlj
import os


def cat(p):
    with open(p) as f:
        return f.read()


class NewlineJSONFormat(luigi.format.Format):

    input = 'dict'
    output = 'text'

    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        self.args = args
        self.kwargs = kwargs
        if 'mode' in kwargs:
            raise ValueError("mode is auto-configured - can't supply as kwarg")

    def pipe_reader(self, input_pipe):
        return nlj.open(iter(input_pipe), mode='r', **self.kwargs.copy())

    def pipe_writer(self, output_pipe):
        return nlj.open(output_pipe, mode='w', **self.kwargs.copy())


path = 'TEST'

tgt = luigi.LocalTarget(path)

print("")
print("Write a file with a single line")
with tgt.open('w') as dst:
    dst.write('LINE')
print(cat(path))
os.remove(path)


print("")
print("Write a file with a single line but raise an exception, which causes the output file to not exist.")
try:
    with tgt.open('w') as dst:
        dst.write('LINE2')
        print("EXCEPTION")
        raise Exception
except Exception:
    pass
try:
    print(cat(path))
    os.remove(path)
except Exception:
    pass


print("")
print("Write a file with a single NLJ line")
nlj_tgt = luigi.LocalTarget(tgt.path, format=NewlineJSONFormat())
with nlj_tgt.open('w') as dst:
    dst.write({'key': 'value'})
print(cat(path))
os.remove(path)


print("")
print("Write a file with a single NLJ line but raise an exception like above")
try:
    with nlj_tgt.open('w') as dst:
        dst.write({'key': 'value'})
        print("EXCEPTION")
        raise Exception
except Exception:
    pass
try:
    print(cat(path))
    os.remove(path)
except Exception:
    pass
```

output:

```

Write a file with a single line
LINE

Write a file with a single line but raise an exception, which causes the output file to not exist.
EXCEPTION

Write a file with a single NLJ line
{"key": "value"}


Write a file with a single NLJ line but raise an exception like above
EXCEPTION
{"key": "value"}
```

items.title: Don't log exceptions on write
items.body:
[Catching and logging exceptions on write](https://github.com/geowurster/NewlineJSON/blob/master/newlinejson/core.py#L259-L268) creates messy terminal output for downstream users.  The snippet below is logged when catching a `BrokenPipeError` and is impossible to exclude from `stdout`.

```
ERROR:root:Encountered an error while writing: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/Christian/code/GFW/stuffz/venv/lib/python3.5/site-packages/newlinejson/core.py", line 263, in write
    return self._stream.write(encoded + self._linesep)
BrokenPipeError: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
```

items.title: ImportError: No module named click
items.body:
My first time trying out this library, and just got the following:

``` bash
$ pip install newlinejson
$ python -m newlinejson --help
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/runpy.py", line 162, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
    exec code in run_globals
  File "/mnt/home/ec2-user/venv_pgsql/lib/python2.7/site-packages/newlinejson/__main__.py", line 14, in <module>
    import click
ImportError: No module named click
```

A `pip install click` solves the problem. I see that `click` is indeed included in the dependencies in `setup.py`, on master at least. Has the latest version been pushed to PyPI?

items.title: Release 1.0
items.body:
- [x] Close out milestone
- [x] Pull onto a branch
- [x] Update version
- [x] Update changelog
- [x] Update docs
- [x] Run tests
- [x] Push to git + merge
- [x] Tag a release
- [x] Push to PyPi (as a wheel?)

items.title: Update packaging
items.body:
Look over `setup.py` etc.

Build wheels?

items.title: Python 2.6 support
items.body: Easy to support and not that uncommon

items.title: Profile code
items.body: To avoid any weird surprises

items.title: Compression
items.body: Would be nice to be able to transparently read/write gzip and bz2 since they're in the stdlib.

items.title: Check docstrings, license, etc.
items.body: and `__all__`

items.title: Consolidate CLI
items.body: Don't really need the `tool` module.

items.title: Allow json_lib to be a string or module
items.body: If its a string, import.  Helps some downstream projects.  Expose in CLI if easy.

items.title: Implement NLJStream.name
items.body: Like Python's `file`.

items.title: Cleanup and review
items.body:
- [ ] Replace `pycompat` with `six`.
- [ ] Rename `Stream()` to `NLJStream()` for better type checking.
- [ ] General scrubbing.

items.title: newlinejson.tool as a CLI
items.body:
Similar to `json.tool`. to support the syntax: `cat file.csv | python -m newlinejson.tool.csv2nlj`.

Add a click dependency in `setup.py` `extras_require` in `cli`.
- [x] csv2nlj
- [x] nlj2csv
- [x] insp - should be able to load a JSON encoded string that is a list of JSON objects as well
- [x] Document in readme

items.title: Stream.num_failures
items.body: Keep track of how many rows failed to be read or written.

items.title: Use py.test and pytest-cov instead of nose
items.body: Broken test output is far more informative and the changes are minimal.

items.title: Use setuptools install_requires and extras_require instead of requirements/-dev.txt
items.body:
- [ ] Remove requirements parsing from setup.py
- [ ] Travis command should be `pip install -e .[all]`
- [ ] Update readme commands

items.title: Better exception handling when read/write errors are encountered.
items.body:
Example error below - moderately useful at best:

``` python
  File "./tracker.py", line 97, in <module>
    main()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 664, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 644, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 991, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 837, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 464, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "./tracker.py", line 33, in getseries
    fieldnames = list(src.next().keys())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/newlinejson/core.py", line 252, in next
    raise e
ValueError: No JSON object could be decoded

```

items.title: Write mode is broken
items.body: Need to pass `mode` to `builtin_open` in `core.open`.

items.title: Fix un-covered lines found by nosetest --with-coverage
items.body:
There are a few uncovered lines.  Looks like most (all?) are Py3.

```
Name               Stmts   Miss  Cover   Missing
------------------------------------------------
newlinejson            7      0   100%   
newlinejson.core     109      7    94%   71, 107, 274, 297, 483, 496, 519
newlinejson.nlj       77      3    96%   212, 242, 271
------------------------------------------------
```

https://travis-ci.org/geowurster/NewlineJSON/jobs/48854390

items.title: Remove restrictive settings from setup.cfg
items.body: The current `setup.cfg` file constrains `nosetests` in a way that prevents the user from only running the tests and not getting a coverage report.

items.title: Check examples in README.md
items.body: Loading newline JSON from a string via `newlinejson.loads()` does not display the proper code.  Others are incorrect as well.

items.title: Add write() method to Writer class
items.body: Alias `Writer.writerow()` to `Writer.write()` or vice versa

items.title: Add a Reader/Writer.failures attribute
items.body: When `skip_failures=True` the user may still want to know how many lines were skipped due to a failure when reading/writing a file.

items.title: Investigate adding adapters for newline JSON stored in packed binary formats
items.body:
- [ ] [ProtoBuf](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/)
- [ ] [Thrift](http://thrift.apache.org)
- [ ] [Message Pack](http://msgpack.org)
- [ ] [Avro](http://avro.apache.org)

items.title: Add note about specifying JSON library in README
items.body: By default the built in JSON library is used by but the user can manually specify whatever library they want.  Several are fully tested: `ujson`, `simplejson`, and `yajl` but it is up to the user to specify which library they would like to use.  The commandline utilities can also specify which JSON library they will use.

items.title: New CLI Commands
items.body:
`csv2dict` - Convert a CSV to newline with one dictionary per line.
`csv2list` - Convert a CSV to newline with one list per line.  Need a flag to specify if the header should be written.
